‘Gaalibaaz' vs 'AAP-da-e-azam’: AAP, BJP poster war heats up ahead of Delhi poll - Hindustan Times
summary:
A political poster war has erupted between AAP and BJP in Delhi, with both parties drawing inspiration from blockbuster films.

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Days before the Delhi assembly election, a poster war erupted on Saturday between the ruling Aam Aadmi Party and opposition Bharatiya Janata Party, with the Arvind Kejriwal-led party portraying BJP's Kalkaji candidate Ramesh Bidhuri as a villain from the movie Bahubali 1.

  • The ruling AAP posted on X, portraying the BJP's Kalkaji candidate in a negative light.
  • The BJP responded by attacking Arvind Kejriwal in their own poster.
  • The Delhi Assembly elections are scheduled for February 5, 2025.
  • Voting will be followed by a count on February 8.
“Delhi ki janta ne thaana hai, sheeshmahal wale AAP-da-e-aazam ko bhagana hai.” (People of Delhi have decided to oust the 'Sheesh Mahal' AAP-da-e-azam)

This poster war highlights the intense competition and dramatic tactics employed by both parties as they approach the impending elections.
newTitle: AAP and BJP Engage in Political Poster War Ahead of Delhi Elections

'Rs 2,026cr loss to exchequer': BJP targets AAP over CAG report on 'liquorgate' - The Times of India
summary:
BJP Criticizes Kejriwal Over CAG Report on Liquor Scandal

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

The BJP has launched a strong attack on Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal following a CAG report that alleges a loss of Rs 2,026 crore in a liquor policy scandal. The AAP dismisses these claims as 'fake.'

  • The CAG report indicates significant financial discrepancies in the liquor policy.
  • BJP leaders accuse Kejriwal's government of corruption and mismanagement.
  • AAP's representatives have vehemently rejected the allegations, labeling them a political ploy.
“These claims are absurd and fabricated. We will not be deterred by BJP's smear campaign.” - AAP Spokesperson

This ongoing political tussle highlights the contentious relationship between BJP and AAP amid serious allegations of financial misconduct.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Kejriwal Over CAG Report on Liquor Scandal

title: Man makes fun of Chandra Arya who joined Canada's PM race: ‘Broken English, thick Indian accent’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Controversy Surrounds Chandra Arya's Bid for Canadian PM Amid Ridicule

Publication Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Indian-origin MP Chandra Arya's announcement to run for Prime Minister of Canada has sparked controversy and ridicule, particularly concerning his English proficiency and accent.

  • Arya is a member of the Liberal Party and has been a representative since 2015.
  • He announced his candidacy following Justin Trudeau's resignation, aiming for a more efficient government.
  • Arya faces criticism, including mockery of his language skills on social media.
  • He has previously expressed pride in speaking Kannada in the Canadian parliament.
“This dude moved to Canada at the age of FORTY THREE, speaks broken English with a thick Indian accent, and yet is somehow an MP and running to be the next Prime Minister,” wrote Chris Brunet.

The public’s reaction indicates a mix of support and backlash, focusing on Arya’s background and candidacy in light of national leadership.
newTitle: Controversy Surrounds Chandra Arya's Bid for Canadian PM Amid Ridicule

Six arrested after 18-year-old Dalit girl in Kerala alleges sexual abuse by 62 people over five years - Moneycontrol
summary:
Six Arrested After 18-Year-Old Dalit Girl Alleges Sexual Abuse by 62 People in Kerala

Date: January 11, 2025 / Source: The Indian Express

Kerala Police have arrested six individuals following allegations made by an 18-year-old Dalit girl, who claims she was sexually abused by approximately 62 people over five years.

  • The case was initiated after the girl spoke to volunteers from the Kerala Mahila Samakhya Society.
  • Two FIRs have been filed across different police stations in Pathanamthitta district.
  • Police confirmed the arrest of five suspects in one case and another in a separate case.
  • The investigation is ongoing, with a deputy superintendent of police leading the inquiry.
"She received counseling and finally opened up to a psychologist about the sexual abuse she has endured since the age of 13." - Advocate N Rajeev

This serious allegation has highlighted issues of sexual violence and the challenges faced by victims in reporting such crimes.
newTitle: Six Arrested After 18-Year-Old Dalit Girl Alleges Sexual Abuse by 62 People in Kerala

title: IMD forecasts heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, issues ‘yellow alert’ for tomorrow | Updates - Hindustan Times
summary:
IMD forecasts heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, issues ‘yellow alert’ for tomorrow | Updates

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rain and issued a yellow alert for parts of Tamil Nadu, specifically targeting Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Nagapattinam, Mayiladuthurai, Pudukottai districts, and Karaikal.

  • Heavy rain expected on January 12 with isolated thunderstorms and lightning.
  • Cyclonic circulation influencing the weather across Southeast Bay of Bengal.
  • Cold wave conditions observed in northern India.
  • Dense fog affecting various regions including New Delhi.
“Light to moderate rainfall accompanied with thunderstorm, lightning very likely at a few places over Coastal Andhra Pradesh & Yanam and Rayalaseema.”

Preparedness for heavy rainfall and associated weather phenomena is advised.
newTitle: IMD Issues Yellow Alert for Heavy Rain in Tamil Nadu

title: BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - Start - SarkariExam.com
summary:
BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - Start

Date: January 11, 2025   |   Source: Bihar School Examination Board, Patna

Short Information: Bihar School Examination Board, Patna (BSEB) has invited application for the Diploma In Elementary Education (D.El.Ed) Admission 2025. Online Registration Process for BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 has started from 11 January 2025 & the candidates can apply till 22 January 2025. Candidates must check the complete details for BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 which is given below.

Important Dates

  • Notification Date: 11 January 2025
  • Application Start Date: 11 January 2025
  • Last Date: 22 January 2025
  • Fee Payment Last Date: 22 January 2025
  • Correction Date: Notify Later
  • Exam Date: Notify Soon
  • Admit Card: Before Exam

Application Fee

  • General, EWS, BC, EBC: Rs. 960/-
  • SC, ST, Divyang: Rs. 760/-
  • Fee payment can be made through Debit Card, Credit Card, Net Banking, UPI, and other modes.

Age Limit

  • Minimum Age: 17 Years
  • Maximum Age: NA Years
  • Age Relaxation as per BSEB rules.

Educational Qualification

  • Candidates must have passed their Intermediate (Class 12th) examination with at least 50% marks (General/OBC) & 45% marks (SC/ST) from a recognized board.

How To Apply

  • Candidates can apply through the official site of the BSEB before the last date.

Mode of Selection

  • Selection will be based on online or written entrance examination.

Conclusion: The BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission application process has begun, and interested candidates are encouraged to apply before the deadline.
newTitle: BSEB Bihar D.El.Ed Admission Online Form 2025 - Start

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has released a humorous spoof video aimed at the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) regarding the controversial 'Sheesh Mahal'. This video seeks to highlight alleged corruption within the AAP government.

Assam reports first HMPV case this season as 10-month-old child tests positive in Dibrugarh - Hindustan Times
summary:
Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season

Date: Jan 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Assam has reported its first case of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) infection this season, with a 10-month-old child testing positive. The infant is currently undergoing treatment at Assam Medical College and Hospital (AMCH) in Dibrugarh and is said to be stable.

  • Ten-month-old child tests positive for HMPV in Dibrugarh, Assam.
  • Child admitted to AMCH with cold-related symptoms four days ago.
  • HMPV infection confirmed by ICMR-RMRC Lahowal after routine tests.
  • HMPV is a common respiratory virus that usually causes mild symptoms.
  • Similar HMPV cases reported in Gujarat, Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Tamil Nadu.
“The HMPV infection was confirmed yesterday after we got test results from Lahowal-based ICMR-RMRC. The child is stable now. It is a common virus, and there is nothing to worry about.” - Dr. Dhrubajyoti Bhuyan, AMCH superintendent

The detection of HMPV is not unusual, as the virus circulates seasonally and typically impacts infants and individuals with weaker immune systems more severely.
newTitle: Assam Reports First Case of HMPV Infection This Season
